Detective DeNoux interviewed Jefferson Parish Sheriff's Office, Second
District Deputy Ralph Peperone, who advised that the victim was Mrs. Betty Neff,
white female, date of birth: 01-31-40, who resides at 401 Twentieth Street, Apartment
# 56, Gretna, Louisiana, phone: 366-7797. Deputy Peperone advised that Mrs. Neff
was at her place of business. Sweet Memories Antique Shop, at the time of the
incident.
According to Deputy Peperone, Mrs. Neffawasalone in her shop when an unknown
black male subject entered, looked around then pulled a revolver on the victim
and forced her into the rear bathroom and raped her. Deputy Peperone advised he
had found no witnesses.
The Sweet Memories Antique Shop was a caramel colored concrete, one story
Thebuilding with a glass front door which faced west and a brown flat roof. The front ..
of the shop faced Whitney Avenue and had homerous "plate glass windows which were
covered with from bars. The building which housed the shop also housed another
business on the north side of the shop which was called Neff's Restaurant and
Disco and bore the municipal address of 361 Whitney Avenue. The building in
question was located at the northeast corner of Whitney Avenue and Costanza Street.
"Adjacent to the south side of the building was a large abandoned lot which was
overgrown with brush. The rear of the building faced east where another large open
field was located.
Across Whitney Avenue, which had a canal dividing it into two separate streets,
directly across from Sweet Memories was a defunct business with the sign "Whitney
Bar" on its facade. There was no open business within a two block radius of Sweet
